verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> that came to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> concerning the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> before that Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> Gaza. <S%H5804><s%>

Thus says <S%H559><s%> Yahweh: <S%H3068><s%> Behold, <S%H4325><s%> waters rise up <S%H5927><s%> out of the north, <S%H6828><s%> and shall become an overflowing <S%H7857><s%> stream, <S%H5158><s%> and shall overflow <S%H7857><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> and all that is therein, <S%H4393><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> and those who dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein; <S%H120><s%> and the men shall cry, <S%H2199><s%> and all the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> shall wail. <S%H3213><s%>

At the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the stamping <S%H8161><s%> of the hoofs <S%H6541><s%> of his strong <S%H47><s%> ones, <S%H7494><s%> at the rushing of his chariots, <S%H7393><s%> at the rumbling <S%H1995><s%> of his wheels, <S%H1534><s%> the fathers <S%H1><s%> don't <S%H6437><s%> look back to their children <S%H1121><s%> for feebleness <S%H7510><s%> of hands; <S%H3027><s%>

because of the day <S%H3117><s%> that comes <S%H935><s%> to destroy <S%H7703><s%> all the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> to cut off <S%H3772><s%> from Tyre <S%H6865><s%> and Sidon <S%H6721><s%> every helper <S%H5826><s%> who remains: <S%H8300><s%> for Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will destroy <S%H7703><s%> the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of the isle <S%H339><s%> of Caphtor. <S%H3731><s%>

Baldness <S%H7144><s%> has come <S%H935><s%> on Gaza; <S%H5804><s%> Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> is brought to nothing, <S%H1820><s%> the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of their valley: <S%H6010><s%> how long will you cut yourself? <S%H1413><s%>

You <S%H1945><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> how long will it be before <S%H3808><s%> you be quiet? <S%H8252><s%> Put up <S%H622><s%> yourself into your scabbard; <S%H8593><s%> rest, <S%H7280><s%> and be still. <S%H1826><s%>

How can you be quiet, <S%H8252><s%> since Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has given you a command? <S%H6680><s%> Against Ashkelon, <S%H831><s%> and against the <S%H3220><s%> seashore, <S%H2348><s%> there has he appointed it. <S%H3259><s%>
